title: Media Influence and Information Flow Overview
summary: Summarizes observations of how mainstream and digital media ecosystems shape or filter civic information circulation.
details: Analyzes structural incentives in journalism and platform algorithms that lead to under-coverage of civic anomalies.
Describes the feedback loop where information overload results in reduced discernment and institutional accountability.
Identifies the need for independent data mirroring to ensure persistence of verifiable civic records.

updates.text: Baseline file created as reference for comparative studies on communication flow.
